item.title: Ambulatory Software Team Lead (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description:
Description

Organization: Application Outsourcing

Location: Palo Alto, CA

People within the Client Operations-AO workgroup are responsible for the day-to-day provision of long-term outsourcing services to one or several clients. Client Operations is where the majority of Services people reside and, typically, people in the workgroup are based permanently at a client location.

Our AO resources can expect to:

 Incorporate skills which support the programming, management and maintenance services required to implement and support new installations or maintain and improve existing legacy systems for our clients.
 Receive ongoing training to build and extend professional, technical and management skills in all areas
 Enjoy our comprehensive and generous benefits package

The Team Lead is responsible for delivering the support, maintenance and development of an application or application module supported by a High Performance Team (HPT). The primary responsibility of a Team Lead is to provide work request and personnel management at a team level, manage performance to quality and service levels. The Team Lead manages the team members' adherence of standard processes, maintenance of quality and performance to service levels and schedule. The Team Lead works collaboratively with the Ambulatory Support Manager to coordinate project schedules, budgets, work request management, resource planning, work authorization and manage knowledge transfer. The Team Lead participates in functional review and design, and is responsible for Process Excellence within the team. The Team Lead is required to be certified in Epic and have hands on experience with the application(s) in which they will be managing. The Team Lead must be flexible with work hours and be in position to work off hours as needed or appropriate.

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications:

 Minimum 4 years of experience directing large-scale software application service delivery teams
 Minimum 4 years of demonstrated, deep experience with software application lifecycle methods, processes and tools
 Bachelors degree

Additional Preferred Skill Requirements:

 Previous H&LS team lead experience
 Epic implementation and support leadership experience
 Software package support leadership experience
 On/Offshore support model leadership experience
 Clinical or Health & Life Science experience is an advantage
 Has interacted extensively with senior business and IT executives
 Planned and managed complex IT programs including planning, budgeting, resource management, deliverable development, timelines, issues and risks
 Worked extensively with software vendors on IT service delivery engagements

Please submit resumes online at https://tas-accenture.taleo.net/careersection/10003/jobdetail.ftl?lang=en&job=00072061

Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration.

Applicants for employment in the U.S. must possess work authorization which does not require sponsorship by the employer for a visa.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer.
